decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to assemble a disruptive and resilient board presence while applying pressure to the opponent's life total. This is achieved through a combination of efficient creatures like Deathrite Shaman, Tarmogoyf, and Leovold, along with disruptive spells like Flusterstorm, Force of Will, and Assassin's Trophy. The deck also includes powerful card draw and selection spells such as Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Brainstorm to maintain card advantage and find the necessary answers. The deck leverages its resource advantage to control the game and ultimately secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy a variety of artifact creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan by taxing their mana resources with cards like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst. By leveraging powerful mana acceleration tools like Mishra's Workshop and the Moxen, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered threats like Fleetwheel Cruiser and Walking Ballista. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive artifacts like Phyrexian Revoker and Trinisphere helps to control the game and ensure victory through aggressive and efficient play.

This deck focuses on efficiently casting and recurring spells from the graveyard using Underworld Breach. The goal is to assemble a powerful combo using cards like Brain Freeze to mill the opponent out or generate a large storm count, ultimately leading to a game-winning play. With a combination of card draw, counterspells, and mana acceleration, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly assembling a lethal combo. The key strategy revolves around utilizing the graveyard as a resource and leveraging the powerful interaction between Underworld Breach and various spells in the deck.

The deck is focused on utilizing efficient and powerful spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while also maintaining pressure through aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Monastery Mentor. The deck aims to generate card advantage through powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall, Treasure Cruise, and Dack Fayden, while also having a strong counter package with cards like Force of Will and Pyroblast. The mana base is designed to support the spells while also having access to all colors for maximum flexibility in casting spells.

This deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells to control the board and outpace the opponent. By utilizing powerful cards like Force of Will and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Oko, Thief of Crowns to pressure the opponent, this deck aims to establish early dominance and maintain control throughout the game. With a mix of countermagic, card draw, and efficient threats, this deck is designed to outmaneuver opponents and secure victories through a combination of tempo and attrition.

This Vintage MUD deck focuses on assembling a board state with efficient artifact creatures and disruptive artifacts to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By using mana acceleration from artifact mana sources like Black Lotus and the Moxen, along with powerful artifacts like Sphere of Resistance and Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats such as Arcbound Ravager and Fleetwheel Cruiser to quickly close out the game. The deck leverages the synergy between artifact creatures and artifact-based disruption to create a fast and aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Oath of Druids enchantment to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Niv-Mizzet onto the battlefield early. It also includes various control elements such as counterspells like Force of Will and Pyroblast, disruption with cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland, as well as card advantage engines like Dack Fayden and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck aims to control the game early with disruption and then overwhelm the opponent with big threats once Oath of Druids is activated.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Golgari Grave-Troll, and Stinkweed Imp, then use cards like Bridge from Below and Narcomoeba to generate a swarm of creatures. This allows you to constantly attack your opponent with powerful creatures like Hollow One and Prized Amalgam. Additionally, you can disrupt your opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will. The deck relies on synergy between graveyard manipulation and powerful creatures to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful Planeswalkers like Dack Fayden, Narset, Oko, and Wrenn and Six to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes a variety of counter spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its threats, along with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Assassin's Trophy to disrupt the opponent's resources. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize its ability to cast spells efficiently, while also including utility lands like Strip Mine and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Basking Rootwalla, Bloodghast, Hogaak, and Vengevine, utilizing cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Once Upon a Time to enable explosive plays. Force of Vigor provides removal and disruption, while Deathrite Shaman and Hollow One offer additional versatility and aggression. The deck also includes powerful vintage staples like Ancestral Recall and Moxen for added consistency and power. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats and disrupt their game plan with graveyard-based synergies.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Bazaar of Baghdad to quickly fill the graveyard and power out aggressive creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Hollow One. By utilizing cards like Serum Powder and Once Upon a Time, the deck aims to consistently have explosive starts and overwhelm the opponent with early threats. It also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to protect its game plan. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, aiming to close out the game before the opponent can establish a defense.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively control the opponent's resources while using efficient threats to quickly close out the game. By disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Wasteland, and countering key spells with Force of Will and Pyroblast, the deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can deploy powerful creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Hullbreacher to secure victory. The inclusion of powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time ensures that the deck can continue applying pressure and maintain its advantage throughout the game.

This deck focuses on using artifact prison pieces to lock down the opponent's ability to cast spells and disrupt their game plan. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void, Thorn of Amethyst, and Sorcerous Spyglass, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their strategies. With powerful mana acceleration from cards like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb, the deck can quickly deploy its threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to further solidify its control over the game.

The deck seeks to efficiently draw through the deck with cantrips and tutors to set up a winning Doomsday combo. The win condition involves casting Doomsday, stacking the deck in a specific order, and then using Thassa's Oracle to win the game by having zero cards left in the library. The deck features a high amount of disruption and protection spells to ensure the combo can be executed successfully and to prevent opponents from interfering. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful draw spells and card selection tools helps improve consistency and speed in achieving the combo.

The main idea of this deck is to use graveyard mechanics to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures such as Golgari Grave-Troll, Golgari Thug, and Shambling Shell. By utilizing cards like Cabal Therapy and Bazaar of Baghdad, the player can efficiently dredge through their deck and bring back powerful creatures like Hollow One and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. With the help of cards like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam, the player can create a strong board presence and overwhelm their opponent with an aggressive strategy. Additionally, cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection against opposing threats.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo potential of Underworld Breach, allowing the player to cast spells from their graveyard by exiling cards with the escape mechanic. By combining card draw, counterspells, and tutor effects, the deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to generate a large storm count with Brain Freeze or disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of powerful spells such as Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, as well as versatile cards like Dack Fayden and Pyroblast, further enhance the deck's ability to control the game and set up game-winning combos.
